column1: -il is a little-attested ending in the Sindarin language
column2: Some of the examples refer to Noldorin as well used sometimes to denote feminine gender. Its masculine counterpart is -on.

column1: Its presence causes i-affection to the vowels of the stem (cf. brannon and brennil).

Possibly it derives from a Common Eldarin ending *-illê. This is supported by several Quenya words which end in -illë with Sindarin cognates in -il; most notably compare the Quenya amille "mother" and the Sindarin emil.

column2: -il is said to be a diminutive ending; compare how the masculine ending -on can sometimes refer to "great" things.
